text: Welcome to howtocookthat.net I'm Ann Reardon.

For a printable copy of any of the recipes
don't forget to check out the website at howtocookthat.net.

Today we're looking at how to make a fondant
face which you can use on a princess doll
cake if you don't wanna use a Barbie doll.

I'm using Cake Art Food Grade casting gel
which is a silicon type gel, but it is food
grade so it's safe to use with food.

So choose a doll that has a face similar to
what you want and then make the neck go right
back then put it into the casting gel.

So you just melt that gel in the microwave,
and then put it into a bowl or container that

you are going to use and just leave it to
set.

Once it has set, upi just peel it out and
the good thing about this stuff is that it's

re-usable so once you finish using it for
this purpose you can just melt it again in

the microwave and use it again for something
else.

Now when I'm doing faces I like to take it
out of the bowl so that when you push the

fondant in, you push it right in so that you
get the nose and everything.

So I stretch, see how I'm stretching it open
there and then pushing the fondant right in,

turning it over to check you've got it all
the way through to the nose, cause obviously
you don't want a big air bubble on the nose.

And then you just pop that in the freezer
to firm up.

So probably about 15 to 20 minutes and then
place some spaghetti into the neck so that

you've got something to attach it to the rest
of the body with once you've finished, and

also it gives you something to hold onto when
you're actually applying the make-up.

And then just gently peel it away from the
edges.

And once you've loosened all the the edges
it should come out quite easily.
And then Have a look.

If you've got any air bubbles, I had a couple
air bubbles at the corner of the mouth in

my mould, then they're gonna come out as raised
bumps.

So just use a knife to take those off and
then if you're gonna add a different colored

fondant hair, trim off the excess skin colored
hair that you have there.

And then using your gel colors, just color
the face as you can see on the doll that you

were using, so starting with white for the
teeth and the eyes, and then I'm gonna use

some silver Luster Dust for the eye shadow
so you've got a bit of sparkle there, then
do your lips using some red gel color.

If you've got too much, just use a dry brush
to brush some off and then next apply your

mascara which of course is just black food
gel color, and your pupils and the colored
patch of your eyes.

And you can see pretty quickly that it starts
to come to life.

And then a little bit pink in the corners
of the eyes and then just apply some fondant
hair in whatever color that you need.

Thank you to everyone who has subscribed,
clicked to share and clicke on like.

If you wanna see the other videos on this
channel, then just click on the link provided.
Enjoy.
